p: Blood components are expensive and potentially dangerous, and their availability is often limited [ 50]. Fresh Frozen Plasma (FFP) transfusions may cause allergic reactions with immediate hypersensitivity (e.g., urticaria and anaphylaxis) and a respiratory distress syndrome associated with pulmonary infiltrates, non-cardiogenic pulmonary oedema, which is mediated by soluble agents (cytokines). In addition, similar to other blood components, these transfusions carry the risk of infectious disease transmission, including hepatitis B and C, syphilis and human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) [ 40].
